revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Billion |model=BiPAC 7800VNOX |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=04/25/2013 |manuf_country=Taiwan |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router,dsl modem,analog phone gateway |fcc_id=QI3BIL-7800VNOX |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM6361 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L12835EMI-10G |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=256 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4T1G084QF-BCF7 |ram1_num=2 |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM6361 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL,RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53125 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags=ADSL2+ |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=wlan-ap |default_ssid_regex=^wlan-ap$ |default_ip=192.168.1.254 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui= |oui_eth= }} ''Wireless-N ADSL2+/Fibre Broadband Router''
Per the FCC internal photos, this device uses the following... *ADSL+WiSoC: BCM6361KFEBG **+ BCM6302KMLG Line Driver ? *GbE Switch: BCM53125SKMMLG *2x [http://www.zarlink.com/zarlink/VE890_product_preview_sept09.pdf '''Zarlink''' / '''Legerity''' Le89316QVC (Le89316) + Le89810BSC (Le89810)] (VoIP, 2x FXS + 1x FXO), omitted on some models? .. a '''Samsung''' K9F4G08U0D-SCB0 NAND Flash (4Gb / 512MB) is also shown on the board, but it seems that it may not actually be used on any models covered by this FCC ID.. hmm..
.. this device may share the same board as the [[Billion BiPAC 7800VDPX]]. There is space (unpopulated) for a 5GHz radio on the board.
The FCC test report states that the data is applicable to the...<small> *'''BEC''' 7800VNOX **Detachable antenna, grey upper + silver lower casing, no NAND *'''BEC''' 7800VNPX **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN *'''BEC''' 7801VNP **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, 1 port FXS+FXO, no USB *'''BEC''' 7801VNPX **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, 1 port FXS+FXO *'''BEC''' 6800VNPX **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, no DSL *'''BEC''' 6800VNP **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, no DSL, no USB *'''BEC''' 6801VNPX **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, 1 port FXS+FXO, no DSL *'''BEC''' 6801VNP **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, 1 port FXS+FXO, no DSL, no USB *'''BEC''' 7800NX **Detachable antenna, gray upper + silver lower casing, no NAND, no VoIP *'''BEC''' 7800NXL **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, no VoIP *'''BEC''' 7800N ''R2'' **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no USB, no VoIP</small> ... but look at the tables in the test report for a better comparison of the units, assuming any of this is even accurate..
Default settings are per the FCC manual.
The manual specifies three login credentials for the device.. *'''Administrator:''' admin/admin *'''Local:''' user/user *'''Remote:''' support/support
